channel.title: Interface building

item.title: Interface building
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

[quote=“supra s, post:2, topic:251331”][quote author=Radical.dude link=topic=331717.msg2590075#msg2590075 date=1229724917]
Tab.getGraphics();
I have no idea.

[/quote]

why do you post then ??[/quote]

I think the only way you can make it grab the images from the cache would be if it downloaded the cache put a folder in there for the images, and then go in class30_sub2_sub1_sub1… And then replace the location to c:/“filename”/“foldername”/“imagename.imagetype” and then that should load it… so it would be like this

c:/.cache_store_32/images/background.png

I hope that helped you.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface building
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

how can i let my interface fetch images from my cache ??

my code :

[code]//----
public static void addSpellClick(int id, int spriteOnId, int spriteOffId, String castText)
{
Class9 spell = aClass9Array210[id] = new Class9();
spell.anInt220 = id;//250
spell.anInt236 = id;//236
spell.anInt262 = 5;//262
spell.anInt217 = 1;//217
spell.anInt214 = 0;
spell.anInt220 = 20;//220
spell.anInt267 = 20;//anint267
spell.aByte254 = (byte)0;
spell.anInt230 = 52;
//Sprite
spell.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = method207(spriteOnId, false, aClass44, “magicon2”);
spell.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = method207(spriteOffId, false, aClass44, “magicoff2”);
spell.aString221 = castText;
}
public static Class9 addTab(int id)
{
Class9 Tab = aClass9Array210[id] = new Class9();
Tab.anInt250 = id;//250
Tab.anInt236 = id;//236
Tab.anInt262 = 0;//262
Tab.anInt217 = 0;//217
Tab.anInt214 = 0;
Tab.anInt220 = 512;//220
Tab.anInt267 = 334;//anint267
Tab.aByte254 = (byte)0;
Tab.anInt230 = 0;
return Tab;
}
//----
public static void Cellphone()
{
Class9 Tab = addTab(19000);
addSpellClick(19001, 25, 25, “My Custom Spell”); // right click option
Tab.anInt261 = 0;
Tab.aBoolean266 = false;
Tab.anIntArray240 = new int[1]; //Interface id
Tab.anIntArray241 = new int[1]; //X pos
Tab.anIntArray272 = new int[1]; //Y pos

	Tab.anIntArray240[0] = 19001; //Interface id
	Tab.anIntArray241[0] = 15; //X pos
	Tab.anIntArray272[0] = 15; //Y pos

}
//----[/code]
